name: Hotel Schlosskrone

reviews.text: The Hotel Kurcafe was the nicest hotels we stayed in on our recent trip to Germany/Austria with our three teenage daughters. We were given rooms on the top floor and the rooms were right next to each other. We had a triple and a double. The triple bed could have been better (was pretty much a couch that didn't even pull out). Our rooms faced the street and had a beautiful view. We found an amazing Italian restaurant next door. The breakfast was average, had to pay extra for a cappucino.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

likes.liked: — Close to castles, surprisingly very excellent restaurants.

reviews.title: We had wonderfull holidays
reviews.text: Hotel Kurcafe was the best Hotel my wife and I had in Germany during our 2 weeks trip between Christmas and New Year.
The Hotel offers a great value for the price. The rooms are very nice and offer everything you need (also English TV Channels).
reviews.title: A most enjoyable stay

reviews.text: I liked the painting above the bed a lot - felt like in heaven.
reviews.title: Absolutely appalling !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was excellent and offered goodies from the own Konditorei.
reviews.title: Great value and friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fine hotel, very well situated for exploring the pretty town of Fuessen.For the evening meal we had the set menu and every course was excellent,as was the breakfast.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in lovely town

reviews.text: As well as the amazing Castles nearby, in Fuessen we enjoyed the unusual fountains outside the tourist information centre,the courtyard of Fuessen Castle (which you can walk into in the evening),walking by the river,and of course the town itself.
reviews.title: Bullseye

reviews.text: This hotel is magnificent. As an add-on - we have never experienced such incredible chocolates before. We must've put on lots of weight. We had to drag us away to have a look at the Neuschwanstein castle. The town of fussen itself is teriffic an well worth visiting. It was the first time we've been to the alps and definitely will return next year.
reviews.title: Superb hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: What a wonderful Hotel - absolutely gorgeous. The staff was very attentive, the food was great and the rooms themselves are lovely. WE are definitely going back as we had such a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Very NIce

reviews.text: Stayed in one of the top floor rooms in March 07. 2 adults and 2 children. Found the hotel to be clean and friendly with a good restaurant. Also, they have a small parking lot next to the hotel for
reviews.title: Enjoyed everything it was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The was the most pleasant hotel surprise of our trip. Clean, comfortable, modern, large room with excellent service and a very good restaurant. This was by far the least expensive lodging of our entire vacation and perhaps our best!
reviews.title: Our Best Lodging Surprise

reviews.text: I stayed for 2 nights in August 06 and whilst the dining room shop were very nice, our family bedroom for 2 Adults and 2 Children was very average, it had dirty woodchip paper walls and a very dirty orange carpet throughout. For a supposedly 4 star hotel this was unacceptable. I also noticed that some tables at breakfast were reserved for certain guests and the buffet varied greatly between the two mornings we were there.
reviews.title: Average bedroom
A lovely htoel in a charming town
reviews.text: My husband, college-aged daughter and I found ourselves in Fussen on a cold night in March without a place to stay after doing the castle tours. We stopped to ask directions and instead ended up staying the night, and what a treat it was! Our room was large, almost like a suite with great beds and warm comforters. The only bit of unpleasantry was no hot water the next morning! (It did come on about an hour later). Breakfast was a nice buffet of fruit, cereal, eggs and breads.

reviews.title: Only tried the restaurant
reviews.text: Stayed a week in an apartment in Fuessen, and ate in the Kurcafe restaurant one evening, but was not impressed. Surroundings and service were good, but my wife's meal of fish with pasta was not - part of the fish was undercooked while the pasta was dry in places, as if it had been reheated. In addition we couldnt get coffee at the end of the meal as the "machine was being cleaned" - I know staff want to get home at some stage but not to be able to serve customers coffee at 9.45pm is pretty poor.

The hotel's location to the train station is one of the best features...just a block straight from the station. The hotel has a pastry shop on the lower level (another great feature). Our room was clean, large and comfortable. The staff was polite and helpful and spoke passing English. The restaurant was great for dinner and the free breakfast. Plenty to choose from for breakfast, with champagne, salmon, meats, cheese, breads and poached eggs. I'd highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Great rooms, restraurant, location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Kurcafe was very nice. The room was spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was the best we had in Europe. The location is great if you are walking or using the trains. We upgraded to a balcony room which first appeared nice. However, the balcany rooms overlook the busy main street of the town and the car noise is loud. I would stay in a regular room overlooking the side street. The view from the balcany rooms is not that great and is just over the town roofs. Luckily, the weather was cool and we were able to keep the window closed. In the summer, with the windows open the noise would be very bad from the traffic. The front desk clerk was very helpful and made reservations at the castles for me by phone. I recommend this because the ticket office sent a confirming fax which the hotel was able to receive and give to me.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on a traffic circle in a busy tourist town. Picture on website is very deceiving as it doesn't show the non-stop traffic circling around the hotel.
reviews.title: Like an Oven

reviews.text: Staff was decent, but appears hotel is unmanned after 10pm until about 7:00am. Room size is pretty good, clean, and decent tv.
reviews.title: Kurcafe - any time
great hotel
reviews.text: Main problem with room - especially those located in the front - is that it is amazingly noisy (this coming from someone who lived in Manhattan) and without a/c you simply cannot close the sound-proof windows or you will roast in the summer. You are forced to pick your poison - heat or noise.

reviews.title: Very expensive, but OK
reviews.text: This town is amazingly close to the castles, but overall I would look to stay in another town altogether. Some nice sites near the water, but overall a weird vibe. My guess is that you can find better, either at base of castles or in Austria.

description: This Superior hotel is in the romantic Old Town district of Fussen, 100 yards from Fussen Train Station. Hotel Schlosskrone offers free Wi-Fi and a spa with a Finnish sauna, steam room and 2 hot tubs.The spacious rooms at the Hotel Schlosskrone Fussen are colorfully decorated and some feature Bavarian décor. All rooms include cable TV and a private bathroom, and some offer individually controlled air conditioning.A full breakfast buffet and a selection of Bavarian and international dishes are served in the elegant Himmelsstube restaurant, while Mediterranean dishes are offered at Chili Restaurant. Homemade cake is served in the cozy cafe with its open fireplace.Guests can enjoy a variety of massage and beauty treatments in the Schlosstherme’s spa. The hotel also has a gym, tropical showers and a large relaxation area.Private parking is available at Hotel Schlosskrone's own underground garage. The famous palaces of Neuschwanstein and Hohenschwangau are a 5 minute drive away.
